meanings.definition: A reconstructed or hypothetical ancestor language from which a group of related languages is believed to have evolved.
meanings.sent1: Linguists study protolanguages to understand how different languages are connected.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use the concept of protolanguages to trace the origins of modern languages.
meanings.sent3: The idea of protolanguages is like solving a puzzle to uncover the roots of communication.
meanings.sent4: Protolanguages are like ancient blueprints guiding the development of new languages.
meanings.sent5: Exploring protolanguages is like delving into the deep history of human speech.

meanings.definition: The earliest form of a language that can be reconstructed through the comparative method.
meanings.sent1: Scholars analyze protolanguages to understand how languages change over time.
meanings.sent2: Studying protolanguages helps linguists track the evolution of different language families.
meanings.sent3: Imagining protolanguages is like looking through a linguistic time machine.
meanings.sent4: Protolanguages serve as linguistic fossils revealing the ancient sounds of our ancestors.
meanings.sent5: The study of protolanguages paints a vivid picture of linguistic evolution.
